item.title: Mode
item.description: What is it? R Rcpp Blueprint Template Python statistics.mode() (Built-in) Custom Pure Python Custom NumPy Shootout Results Environment This post was last updated on 2018-11-26. What is it? Given a sequence, the mode is the value with the highest number of occurrences. Steps find the unique values count the number of occurrences of each value the mode is the value with the highest number of occurrences R r_mode <- function(x) { uniques <- x[!

item.title: Median
item.description: What is it? Walkthrough R Example Data stats::median() Step by Step Naïve Optimized Rcpp Example Data Rcpp::median() Step by Step Naïve Optimized Python Example Data statistics.median() numpy.median() Step by Step Naïve Shootout Test Data Pre-Test Data Validatation Benchmarks Validate Results Post-Test Data Validatation Environment What is it? Given a sequence, which is the middle-most value. Put another way, what value is equally likely to be greater than the first half of a sorted sequence and lesser than the second half of a sorted sequence.
